alert.note: Alert for South Central Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 12 at 2:17PM PST until January 15 at 10:54PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Oregon... Coquille River at Coquille affecting South Central Oregon Coast zone. For the Coquille River...including Coquille...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE SATURDAY NIGHT TO LATE MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Coquille River at Coquille. * WHEN...From late Saturday night to late Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, the Coquille River is at flood stage. Expect flooding of farmland and low-lying areas throughout the flood plain along the Coquille River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 PM PST Friday the stage was 19.6 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (2 pm PST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Coquille River Coquille 21.0 19.6 Fri 1 pm PST 19.9 22.0 20.7 &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. this evening at 1030 PM PST.
